name: Resort at Longboat Key Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live about 65 miles from Longboat Key so decided to stay here checking in 7-1 and checking out 7-4. We reserved and were charged a deposit for a small suite which is one large room, kitchenette, good sized balcony, etc. There are several buildings on the property. We booked over the phone and were assured of a beach front room. Upon check in we were offered a mai tai or glass of wine which is a nice touch. When we got to the room we were disappointed that it was directly overlooking the pool, not the beach. Called to request the room category we reserved and were told they were fully booked and no other rooms were available. We stated we expected the room category we had reserved and already been charged a deposit for and she said she would call back. She called back and offered us the exact same type room 3 floors above. We again stated we expected what we had reserved. She again stated she would call back. She called back and offered another room (strange since she had told us the first time nothing else was available) in a different building and it was beach front as we had reserved. The room was very nice but had some maintenance issues. A light fixture on the wall of the balcony was not only missing a light bulb but also missing any type of fixture that would cover the bulb so we were looking a metal electrical box. Some of the base molding in the kitchen was also missing. We were paying well over $300 per night (due to the holiday weekend) so these types of things should be maintained. Also,this is Florida in July and the rooms really should have ceiling fans. We checked out on July 4 and that morning requested a late check out. Same woman we dealt with over the problem of wrong room category at check in immediately informed us that they were fully booked and it wouldn't be possible. Seems to be her initial response to any request. We might possibly stay here again but would definitely have lower expectations. Like so many hotels they charge a "resort fee" which includes parking, internet access, daily newspaper, etc. A bad practice that doesn't seem to be going away anytime soon. None of these things ruined our stay, but it would have been more pleasant without them.
reviews.title: Nice at first glance

reviews.text: Whilst the hotel was average but acceptable we are moved to warn of the very poor restaurant facil;ities within the complex.
reviews.title: A Real Rip Off'

reviews.text: We visited the 'Sands Pointe' restaurant which is the only restaurant on the main complex and situated beside the reception area. [beware if you are a novice traveller - you could well feel that you are a captive audience]
reviews.title: Really Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As airline staff, the menu at this restaurant is the most sparse that we have encountered and was compounded by the cost - two courses and a glass of wine each COST $140
reviews.title: Great location and solid value

reviews.text: When we politely mentioned to the waiter that the menu was restrictive, we were met with a evening of surley service.
reviews.title: Welcomed right away :-)

reviews.text: We went there for the first time to enjoy the beach and tennis. The location is incredible. The tennis facilities are the best I have ever seen at any resort. The spa was one of the top two spas I have had the pleasure of participating.
reviews.title: Recharging

reviews.text: I just came back from my third stay at the Longboat Key Club. The rooms are lovely, clean and reasonably sized. The amenities and setting are great. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Consistently good

reviews.text: Longboat key is beautiful but the key club does not have any shops within the complex. If you wanted a sun tan lotion or tee shirt you have to walk half mile to the golf club to obtain items or drive 2 miles to St Armands circle The room seemed to be disheveled with the details not inspected. Bed was not made well, towels not crispy folded and staff members smoking in the stairwells .
reviews.title: No shops no shoes no nothin

reviews.text: A very pleasant place; a bit old-fashioned in some ways but the room and facilities are absolutely bang on. We had a club-suite, overlooking the pool; recently renovated I'd say, with everything that you would need for a week in the sun. You'll probably go there by car, so shopping in the Publix supermarket a couple of miles up the road will be no problem. We did eat in the restaurants; light-bites were really good although limited choices, breakfast was fine but not special. Pool service was non-existent, but no problem finding somewhere to lie. The pool itself is weirdly deep - half of it out of my depth and I'm 6 foot. Beach was very nice, a few steps from the hotel, clean, loads of shells and you swim with the fish. Bicycles available to borrow, and plenty of other stuff to do if you get fed up with doing nothing. Not far from Armands Circle (a roundabout, in the USA!) which was a bit underwhelming if you are used to shopping UK-style. It is definitely NOT Florida's answer to Rodeo Drive! It's always difficult to separate a review of the hotel from your enjoyment of the holiday... I enjoyed both and would like to come back again some day.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staying at Longboat Key Resort for three nights in late April ( we got up early one morning to watch the royal wedding on TV!).
reviews.title: An experience we will never forget

reviews.text: My family stayed here for two weeks in a deluxe two bedroom that had a kitchen and balcony with an amazing ocean view. From the moment that I stepped into the suite I was very pleased with the accomodations. It was spacious (1200 sq. ft I believe), beautifiully appointed, and very nice for entertaining as well as relaxing. And the views....the balcony was huge and spacious overlooking the ocean.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort with beautiful beach

reviews.text: The beach was pristine, just like they show on their website photos. The beach service was prompt and came by often to check on us.
reviews.title: Perfect winter blues getaway!

reviews.text: The sports facilities were fabulous. My husband is a tennis player and was pleased with his private lessons with instructors. And the children had a great time at the sports camp.
reviews.title: Not Worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this camp. I watched some of the instruction going on as well as my children asking to go almost every day. They played tennis, golf, kick ball, and had swimming instruction. They also had a healthy snack and lunch.
reviews.title: Liked it, but the weather wasn't at its best :(

reviews.text: The food at the restaurants was very good. Our favorite being Portofino. This restaurant was the first time that my children were ever able to have wheat free/gluten free pizza in a restaurant. The chef was trained in this kind of cooking and had mastered this pizza so well that it was also the best thin crust I had ever tasted. He let me watch him make it as well as gave me his recipe. This was a huge deal for our family, if you travel with family members with food allergies, you will understand why. Other dishes at the restaurant were wonderful as well set in a rustic, cozy Italian ambiance by the bay.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodations and beautiful beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed at the longboat key club recently and had a great time.Apparantly all rooms have been renovated over the past year and our view each morning was of a white beach, framed by the light blue ,gulf of mexico.The gulf water is crystal clear and you could walk out around 30 meters and the water was still not up to my shoulders.Rooms include kitchen, washer/dryer,dish washer and flat screen tv. Read the small print when booking as there is a steep resort fee of around $50 per night.The staff were very polite and helpful and if you wanted to do something more energetic than lie on the beach there is a gym ,spa and18 holes of golf next to the hotel.There are around 20 clay tennis courts and a further 27 holes of golf a 7 minute drive away (north)by complimentary shuttle.St Armands circle is a 5 min drive away (south)featuring restaurants,shops (inc 5 ice cream shops)and offering a gateway to lido key and sarasota,the cultural capital of Florida ,allegedly.To sum up,we were talking to another guest on the beach and he said "If you dont like longboat key, you wont like heaven".Nuff said.
reviews.title: great hotel,superb beach

reviews.text: We've stayed here maybe four times since 2002. The beach is fantastic, tennis is great. We love the area, but the hotel has gotten over crowded. MOre pricey. This year we just didn't think it was worth the money any more. We also used to go because the rooms had kitchens and we had kids. Now the kids are teenagers so not as important any more.
reviews.title: Still nice, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LBKC has been on our our list for a long time, so maybe our expectations were too high. Reservations told us that all the rooms were newly rennovated - but that's hard to believe. Our first room (4206) needed a paint job, the bath tiling looked like it had been patched repeatedly, the safe and one phone didn't work. They moved us to 3404, which was in working order, but there was nothing newly rennovated about it. Killed a roach on the bedroom floor the second night! Won't be going back.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I stayed at the Longboat Key Club for a business trip. The Staff was AMAZING. I checked in and the staff was extremely friendly and placed me in a beautiful club suite overlooking the ocean. The view was spectacular! Later that evening the front desk made dinner reservations and the restaurant really took care of me because I was staying at the resort. That evening I came back to the bar where I met some other guests, and enjoyed the music entertainment. The room was so comfortable and elegant that being away on business was not a chore. I had the opportunity to work out at the fitness facility and eat at several of the restaurants on the grounds. The food and hospitality was again excellent. My last day I had the opportunity to squeeze in 18 holes at the Harborside course. The BLUE nine was very challenging and fun. Since i'm back I have already reccomended to 3 other friends to book there stay at the resort and candidly, I can't wait to go back. It is a beautiful facility with the friendliest staff!
reviews.title: The friendliest Resort with so much to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly suggest getting a room with a direct view of the water. This is by far the nicest hotel in the area. The rooms are large and clean. They are starting to show a little wear, but nothing major. The only issue I had was with the maid service. They didn't refill our soaps and shampoos. When you are paying over 200 a night I would expect this. Nice place but not cheap.
reviews.title: A great place to spend a few days

description: AAA Four-Diamond private beach front resort just off the coast of Sarasota. Elegantly appointed suite accommodations feature a kitchen, washer/dryer, private balcony and twice daily housekeeping. On-site amenities include six restaurants, championship golf, all new Tennis Gardens, Spa, fitness center, marina, year-round Kids Klub and miles of white sand beach.
